summary: This bill, H.R. 2532, aims to prohibit the removal of certain employees within the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) and its sub-agencies and operating divisions. It prevents the use of federal funds to remove employees if such removals would result in the loss of 3% or more of the total HHS workforce or 3% or more of personnel at a sub-agency or division within a 60-day period. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives and referred to multiple committees, including Energy and Commerce, Education and Workforce, Ways and Means, and Natural Resources.
